document.docAuthor: Soares, Geusivam B., Magalhães, Keila X., Silva, Ana Carolina, Carneiro, Jânio S., Barbosa, Lucineia L., Costa, Nayna G. S. & Domingues, Marcus V.
document.docTitle: Mymarothecioides germanoi Soares & Magalhães & Silva & Carneiro & Barbosa & Costa & Domingues 2019, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Monogenoids (Polyonchoinea, Dactylogyridae) from Hydrolycus armatus (Characiformes, Cynodontidae) with the description of a new species of Rhinoxenus and the proposal of a new genus from the Xingu River, Pará, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Monogenoids (Polyonchoinea, Dactylogyridae) from Hydrolycus armatus (Characiformes, Cynodontidae) with the description of a new species of Rhinoxenus and the proposal of a new genus from the Xingu River, Pará, Brazil

taxonomicName.authorityName: Soares & Magalhães & Silva & Carneiro & Barbosa & Costa & Domingues

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type host:
Hydrolycus armatus (Jardine & Schomburgk)
. Site: Gills.
Type locality:
Volta Grande-Xingu River , municipality of Altamira , Pará State , Brazil ( 03°21’15,7’’S; 52°11’47,5’’W ), collected on
June 13, 2015
. Prevalence: 100% of three hosts examined. Mean intensity: 1.3 parasites per infected host. Specimens deposited: Holotype MPEG nº 199; 3 paratypes , MPEG nº 200–202.
Etymology :
The specific name is an homage to the first author’s father ( G.B. Soares ),
Mr. Germano Soares. Zoobank Life Science
Identifier: ( LSID ) for
Mymarothecioides germanoi
n. sp.
is urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act:

n. sp.

Hydrolycus armatus
(Jardine & Schomburgk)
from the Xingu River, Pará State, Brazil.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks:
Mymarothecioides germanoi
n. sp.
is similar to
M. xinguensis
n. sp.
based on the morphology of anchor/bar complexes. However, the new species is easily distinguished from
M. xinguensis
and other congeneric species by possessing a midventral vaginal pore.
